deck: A wide-ranging 64-page fantasy anthology published by Bardic Press from 1994 to 1996. Contributors included Michael Cohen, Andrew Pepoy, Bill Willingham, Jimmie Robinson, Steve Bissette, Trina Robbins, Bryan Talbot, Charles Vess, Drew Hayes, Teri Wood, James Lowder, C. Scott Morse, Jimmy Gownley, and Roberta Gregory.

Scott Morse, James Lowder, and Carla Speed McNeil (with an authorized Elfquest story).

description:
In the near future, the federal government creates a committee to rid society of books it deems unsuitable. The libraries vow to protect their collections, and with the help of local governments, form a military group to defend themselves -- the Library Forces!

English translation of the Japanese manga Library Wars: Love & War.
name: Library Wars: Love & War

deck: Deus Ex is a six issue miniseries based on the upcoming video game, Deus Ex: Human Revolution. It follows the game's cybernetically enhanced main character Adam Jensen, and ties into the storyline of the game.
description: The series is a prequel to the events of the 2011 entry to the Deus Ex series, "Deus Ex: Human Revolution". An Anti-augmentation protest outside Sarif industries is rocked by a bombing from Pro-augmentation terrorists. Adam Jensen, freshly rebuild himself, is head of physical security at Sarif Industries, and takes it on himself to investigate this latest terrorist attack. Jensen's investigation leads him to an old acquaintance he thought was long dead.
name: Deus Ex

description: MYTHOI is Semantink Publishing's inaugural title and the brainchild of writer James Ninness. Wiglaf, Vito, Yuki, Taros and Touch are five unique beings from various mythologies thrust together to defend humanity from an ancient enemy… MYTHOI is set now, not the now of mythological fiction, but the now of flesh and blood monsters where nightmarish beasts have skin, folklore wears clothes and the dreams of humanity hitchhike the roads of earth. With stories from James Ninness and art from the incredible Jed Soriano, Semantink couldn’t be prouder of this flagship title.
name: Mythoi

description:
This miniseries depicts Jennifer Fellows, mild mannered housewife by day, efficient assassin by night. She is no regular hired assassin, however, as she's picking her own targets for no profit, and is apparently revenging herself upon her criminal gang of uncles. The ultra-violent series is a mix of action and dark humor, and, as writer Garth Ennis admits in his first issue letter to the readers, is his overdue return to this style of writing that he's known for and had longed to write for some time after the last few years of his creative output had taken a decidedly more serious turn.

Collected Editions

  • Jennifer Blood: A Woman's Work is Never Done (#1-6)
  • Jennifer Blood: Beautiful People (#7-12)
  • Jennifer Blood: Neither Tarnished Nor Afraid (#13-18)
  • Jennifer Blood: The Trial of Jennifer Blood (#19-24)
  • Jennifer Blood: Blood Legacy (#25-38)
name: Jennifer Blood

description: Marvel UK launched Dracula Lives on 26th October 1974, the same week as another title, Planet of the Apes; they were Marvel UK's 4th and 5th titles. Taking a departure from the other stories thus far reprinted by Marvel UK, Dracula ventured away from Marvel's superhero titles to the new 1970s horror comics, reprinting Dracula from Tomb of Dracula as its lead strip, with back-ups initially from Marvel Spotlight's Werewolf by Night tales, and later Frankenstein Monster, the Living Mummy, Man-Thing, Ghost Rider and Son of Satan. Reflecting this, the comic's title modified to Dracula Lives featuring the Legion of Monsters with #60. The final issue of Dracula Lives, #87, was released on 16th June 1976; a week later it merged into Planet of the Apes, creating a somewhat bizarre combination of apes and vampires.
name: Dracula Lives

description: Marvel girl was an original founding member of the X-men alongside Iceman, Beast, Cyclops, and Angel. She had telekinesis which she could use to move object, shield herself, create telekinetic bolts, and fly. She eventually dropped the name Marvel Girl when she felt she had grown up and went by her actual name Jean Grey.

description: When the one of the last two sacred unicorns are stolen from the solstice festival, two twins go on a journey with the "old flying one" to save the "Young flying one".  Unfortunately it looks like only 5 of the proposed 12 were actually completed as far as I can find.   It started at Warp Graphics and by issue three it was being co-published by Warp Graphics and Apple Comics.
name: Unicorn Isle

description:
Ender Wiggin may have ended humanity's war with the Formic race in the best-selling, award-winning novel "Ender's Game" by Orson Scott Card, but the fight to squash the bugs began long before the battle strategist even took his first baby steps. Now for the first time ever, fans finally get to see how the Ender Saga first began with the seven-issue limited series.

This series has been collected in hard cover as Formic Wars: Burning Earth.
name: Formic Wars: Burning Earth

description: Batgirl busts heads on the streets of Gotham City and redefines her place in the Bat-family! Adam Beechen (ROBIN) teams with artist Jim Calafiore (GOTHAM UNDERGROUND) on a story that sends Batgirl on a quest to conquer her inner demons and prove herself to the world. Collects BATGIRL #1-6.
name: Batgirl: Redemption

Colombian comic with mature content, which was made up in 90´s.

Eric Daniels has powers beyond his imagination. He tries to live his life without meddlers.
description:
One very unique volume. One of the first comic totally made in Colombia with widespread distribution. It represents a great effort to establish the insdutry on Colombia.

Tells the story of Eric Daniels, a druken man with a dark secret, he has alternating personality and Caos is a demon that empowers him. His olny hope: Evelyn a striper that could save him.

description:
With Batman's 300th appearance in DETECTIVE COMICS, editor Julie Schwartz decided to give Batman and Robin a "new look." In 1964, the sales on these characters — believe it or not — were low and in need of a kick-start. But in the hands of Schwartz's talented team of writers and artists, the Dynamic Duo were revitalized and regained their popularity!

By popular demand, DC inaugurates a new Archive series with BATMAN: THE DYNAMIC DUO ARCHIVES Volume One — a 240-page hardcover advance-solicited for arrival in February. Written by Gardner Fox and John Broome, and illustrated by Carmine Infantino & Joe Giella, these celebrated stories have never been collected before! This collection gives comics fans the opportunity to watch a new editorial approach grow and mature.
name: Batman: The Dynamic Duo Archives

deck: The Dark Reign has begun and Norman Osborn has sent Bullseye and Venom after Songbird. A new team of Thunderbolts is formed.
description:
The new creative team of writer Andy Diggle (Losers, Green Arrow: Year One) and penciler Roberto De La Torre (IRON MAN: DIRECTOR OF S.H.I.E.L.D.) shake up Marvel's most unpredictable team! The events of Secret Invasion have taken Norman Osborn out of Thunderbolts Mountain and when the cat is away, the mice will play! Bullseye owes Songbird big time - and now it's time to settle up!

Collects Thunderbolts 126-129 & 132.
name: Thunderbolts: Burning Down The House
